snippet: Images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in Australia under a landmark decision by the country’s High Court.
abstract: Australia's highest court rules tough new cigarette labeling law does not violate the rights of tobacco companies and will take effect in December; images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in the country.
lead_paragraph: Images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in Australia under a landmark decision by the country’s High Court.

headline.seo: Australian Court Strikes Down Tobacco Challenge
headline.main: Australian Court Strikes Down Tobacco Challenge
headline.print_headline: Australian High Court Upholds Tobacco Rules
